item.title: Is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 on PlayStation 5? (Answered)
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/is-kingdom-come-deliverance-2-on-ps5-answered/

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is one of the most highly-anticipated games of 2025. It’s an open-world RPG with epic proportions, giving players a massive story to explore in one of the most immersive environments ever concocted by a developer. It sounds great at first blush, but is Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 on PlayStation 5, or are PS players locked out of the experience?

Let’s find out.

Will Kingdom Come 2 Be on PS5?

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will be released on PS5 when it goes live worldwide on February 4, 2024.

It’ll also be available on PC and Xbox Series X|S consoles – but it’s not being released on Game Pass – yet.

Kingdom Come Deliverance (2018) was available on PlayStation 4, Xbox One, and PC, so Warhorse Studios has followed suit in releasing the follow-up title across the same spread. In March 2024, the first game in the series was also released on Nintendo Switch, which was nothing short of an engineering marvel.

How much will Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Cost on PS5?

Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 is a full-priced, premium release. This expansive game has a gargantuan map (or two) to explore, as well as a story and side content that’ll easily require a 100-hour investment to capture everything.

With that being said, Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will cost $69.99 for the standard edition of the game. If you want more content, you can buy Kingdom Come 2 on PS5 for $89.99, securing the ‘Gold Edition’.

Will Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 Be on PS Plus?

It’s impossible to say if Kingdom Come Deliverance 2 will surface on PS Plus. The first game had a stint on the subscription service, but that was a few years after it hit the open market. It arrived much earlier on Game Pass, and who’s to say that it won’t happen again with KCD2?

I’d recommend that you don’t wait to see if it’ll appear on PlayStation Plus, as you run the risk of having a marvellous game spoiled by those streaming it and talking about it online. This game has a masterful story that must be experienced first-hand, so it’s worth the initial investment.

If you want more evidence, check out my full preview of KCD2.
